title: 107_hr110
content: The "Private Land Conservation Tax Act" allows small farmers and ranchers to receive a tax credit for charitable conservation contributions of land. This Act is cited as the SEC. 30B Private Land Conservation. The "Private Land Conservation Tax Act" allows eligible farmers and ranchers to receive a tax credit equal to 10 percent of the amount that would be allowed as a deduction for a qualified conservation contribution. The credit is limited to $360,000 per year, with a cap based on prior years' credits. The tax credit under the "Private Land Conservation Tax Act" is limited to $360,000 per year, with a special rule for joint returns and an aggregation rule for controlled groups of corporations and persons under common control. The tax credit for eligible farmers or ranchers is limited to the excess of the regular tax reduced by credits, over the tentative minimum tax for the taxable year. For eligible farmers or ranchers, the tax credit is limited to the excess of the regular tax reduced by credits over the tentative minimum tax for the taxable year. An eligible farmer or rancher is defined as an individual or C corporation with at least 60% of gross income from farming. The tax credit for eligible farmers or ranchers is limited to the excess of the regular tax reduced by credits over the tentative minimum tax for the taxable year. To qualify, the individual or C corporation must have at least 60% of gross income from farming and meet certain asset value criteria. An irrevocable election must be made for the tax credit to apply. No deduction under section 170 is allowed for a qualified conservation contribution if the taxpayer elects to take the credit for it. The tax credit for eligible farmers or ranchers is limited to the excess of the regular tax reduced by credits over the tentative minimum tax for the taxable year. A qualified conservation contribution can be made by a taxpayer who elects to take the credit allowed during a 15-taxable-year period. Excess credit can be carried forward to the succeeding taxable year. Private land conservation amendments apply to donations of qualified conservation contributions made after the enactment date. Charitable contribution limit increased for farmers and ranchers in corporate form. The Internal Revenue Code is amended to treat qualified farmers and ranchers as individuals for conservation contributions. The changes apply to taxable years ending after the enactment date. Expansion of estate tax exclusion for land under qualified conservation easement, effective for estates of decedents dying after enactment of the Act.
